description: To erect a new garden room to the rear of no. 17 Stamford Road to replace the existing garden room located in the rear of the garden.
decision_conditions: Tree Protection Plan (TPP) including details of the siting of barriers and/or ground protection for trees at the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing prior to the construction of the outbuilding.REASON: To ensure the trees close to the development are adequately protected.

<p><span style="font-variant-ligatures: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; text-decoration-thickness: initial;">Full details demonstrating how the outbuilding&nbsp;will be constructed within the Root Protection Zone (RPZ) of retained trees shall be submitted to the LPA for approval prior to any works commencing on site.</span><br></p><p>REASON: In order to safeguard biodiversity.&nbsp;</p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification and a drainage layout of a suitable sustainable drainage system (i.e. water butt with overflow, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80- 150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving, etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.

REASON: To ensure that the development will provide a sustainable drainage system. The condition is required to be discharged prior to the commencement of development to ensure that sustainable drainage is incorporated into the design of the development.

<p>Full details of a landscaping plan which includes the magnolia shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA in writing prior to the relevant part of the development is commenced and any trees that die or are severely damaged in the construction of the outbuiling shall be replaced and maintained in perpetuity. &nbsp;</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interests of biodiversity.&nbsp;<br></p><p><br></p>
